definition: stubborn illness/disease that is difficult to treat

sentences.english: Extraction of confession by torture has been one of the persistent ailments in legal affairs.
sentences.chinese: 刑讯逼供一直以来是司法实务中的顽症之一。

sentences.english: The terrorism and hegemonism are the two big historical persistent ailments that the human society faces.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖主义和霸权主义是人类社会面临的两大历史顽症。

sentences.english: Land annexation was a persistent ailment of the Ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 土地兼并是古代中国的一个顽症。

sentences.english: Two of the Tories’ obstinacies look especially worrying.
sentences.chinese: 两个保守党的顽症也让人特别担心。

sentences.english: Cancer is a kind of persistent ailment.

definition: to bring under permanent control/to effect a radical cure
to treat only the symptoms but not the root cause
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research
to take radical measures/to get to the root (of a problem etc)
to treat the symptoms/reactive (rather than proactive)
good medicine/effective prescription/fig. good plan/effective strategy
to treat the symptoms rather than getting to the root of the problem (proverb)/reactive (rather than proactive)
